New Records: Jos Buttler and Alex Hales shared an unbeaten 170-run stand, the highest opening partnership in T20 World Cup semi-finals
Key Match Events: Jos Buttler and Alex Hales shared a superb opening stand to see England reach the target of 169 with four overs to spare
Chris Jordan picked up 3 wickets for 43 runs
Hardik Pandya scored 63 off 33 deliveries with five sixes
Virat Kohli made a half-century before being dismissed by Chris Jordan
Pre-Game Insights: England made two changes from the side that defeated Sri Lanka in the final Super 12s match
India stuck with the same team that played Zimbabwe
Post-Match Reflections: England captain Jos Buttler praised the team's character and performance
India captain Rohit Sharma said India 'did not turn up' and were nervy with the ball
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Adelaide Oval in Adelaide, Australia
The T20 World Cup final will be played between England and Pakistan on Sunday
